page.title: 11 THE PICKLED KNIGHT
page.content: It was on the 16th of October 1779 some workmen were digging a grave for Mrs Frances Ffytche at a position just beneath a niche in the north wall.They discovered a lead coffin without any inscription or marks.The opening of the coffin was delayed for a few days but then the workmen raised the lid.Inside the lead coffin was another coffin made of elm.Inside the coffin was a body.This was covered in a dark olive cement.Once the shell had been broken a view of the body was seen.The coffin was half full with liquid, a liquor of pickle leaving the body half exposed above the surface.It was the body of a man clad in armour.There was no hair on the knight.Folling the disturbance to the body the parishioners were allowed to inspect the body.Then the coffin was closed and put back in its place.
